content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is how you can do it:
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, x::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(x.value) $(x.unit)")
end
```
This `show` function will take an IO stream and a FloatWithUnits instance as input. It then prints the value of the FloatWithUnits object followed by its unit. The value is converted to a string using `$(...)`.

Now you can test it with:
```julia
f = FloatWithUnits(1.8, "meters")
show(STDOUT, f) # prints 1.8 meters
```
